edu.uic.cs.dmtm.apriori

Class InputReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uic.cs.dmtm.apriori.InputReader

  • public class InputReader
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a read(File, File, ArrayList, ArrayList, ArrayList, TreeMap) method to read input data and specifications according to the required format.
    Author:
    Marco Mele, Massimo Piras

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public double read(java.io.File inputFile,
                   java.io.File parametersFile,
                   java.util.ArrayList<Itemset> transactions,
                   java.util.ArrayList<Itemset> cannotBeTogetherItemsets,
                   java.util.ArrayList<Item> mustHaveItems,
                   java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,Item> items)
            throws java.io.IOException
        A reader that parses input files for the application to load formatted data and parameters.
        • parses a list of Items with their MIS from a parameter file, and builds a TreeMap of all the Items contained in the file, indexed by their id
        • reads the value of the SDC parameter
        • parses a list of cannot_be_together and must_have rules filling two ArrayLists of Items and Itemsets
        • reads and parses a list of transactions from a transaction base file and fills in an ArrayList of Itemsets All collection insertions follow the related collection native policies, plus the optionally given ordering rules.
        Parameters:
        inputFile - A File object referring to the transaction base file reflecting given format rules.
        parametersFile - A File object referring to a file of parameters and rules reflecting given format rules.
        transactions - An empty ArrayList of Itemset.
        cannotBeTogetherItemsets - An empty ArrayList of Itemset.
        mustHaveItems - An empty ArrayList of Item.
        items - An empty TreeMap of Item.
        Returns:
        the read value of SDC.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for system I/O errors or bad formatted lines.
